info.name: ApigeeEdge
info.description:
We have developed this Apigee Edge API collection for use against Apigee Edge Orgs.

## Getting Started

Here's how to get started.

1. Set your environment variables for `org` and `env` (or use the collection variables).
2. In the Getting Started folder, _**Get mgmt API token**_ by entering in your credentials (best saved against the Environment Variables) and you may need your Google Authenticator token. The response access token will be saved against the `token` variable.
    
3. Start using the requests in the collection.
    

We hope you enjoy the collection, and please send us any feedback or if you'd like further details on the services we offer.

### Contact us at: [info@sonrai.com.au](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=9.22.2&userId=8084908&teamId=430530)

### [Sonrai Consulting Pty Ltd](https://sonrai.com.au)

## Further detail

See API documentation for more details and for API calls missing from this collection:

[https://apidocs.apigee.com/apis](https://apidocs.apigee.com/apis)

item.name: Getting Started

header.description:
Use this exact token.
Check documentation to ensure token is current https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/management-api-tokens

urlencoded.description: Update environment variables with your username
Update environment variable with your password
(optional) If you use Google Authenticator, enter the code for your Apigee account here

request.description:
You'll need to get an Oauth token using your Apigee Edge credentials, and possibly your 2FA code (see `mfa_token` Key/Value in body) from your Google Authenticator app.

The `saml_prefix` variable should either be blank (if the enterprise does not have SAML enabled on their Apigee Edge Org) or prefixed with the enterprise's prefix for the SAML login.  
For example:  
ORG without SAML-enablement:

```
POST https://login.apigee.com/oauth/token

 ```

ORG that is SAML-enabled

```
POST https://myorg-saml.login.apigee.com/oauth/token

 ```

See: [https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/management-api-tokens](https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/management-api-tokens)

The token will last for 12 hours (43199 seconds).

A _**test**_ will be run after the call to set the "token" environment variable with the token returned in the JSON response.

header.description:
Use this exact token.
Check documentation to ensure token is current https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/management-api-tokens

request.description:
This request can be used to get an OAuth2 token for SAML-authenticated accounts, where a Passcode is required (normal user accounts that are SAML-authenticated). Some machine accounts may not require the SAML passcode, and in that case the usual Get mgmt API toekn request can be used.

Reference: [https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/using-saml](https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/using-saml)

## Alternative:

If you have Linux (or WSL on your Windows laptop) you can use the get_token CLI

1. Download and install acurl and get_token onto your Linux: [https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/auth-tools#install](https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/auth-tools#install)
2. Use the tool to get a token: [https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/using-saml#get_token](https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/using-saml#get_token)
3. Put the token into the `{{token}}` variable
    

The token will last for 12 hours (43199 seconds).

  
A _**test**_ will be run after the call to set the "token" environment variable with the token returned in the JSON response.

header.description:

item.description:
Use the Edge OAuth2 service to get tokens:

[https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/management-api-tokens](https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/system-administration/management-api-tokens)

You'll need to have your Edge user credentials saved in environment variables `username` and `password` (and if you use Google Authenticator for you 2FA you will need to enter that code into the header parameter as well).

Then try the _**POST Get mgmt API token**_ request.

request.description:
Undeploy revision before going ahead and removing any API's.
    
`curl -v -u username:password http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/<orgname>/apis/<api you want to delete>/revisions/<revisionnumber>/deployments?action=undeploy\&env=<env where deployed>\&force=true -X POST`

formdata.description: Use an API Proxy bundle ZIP file

query.description: Use "import" to import the API bundle. Use "validate" to only validate the API bundle and not import it.
Enter the API Name to import

request.description:
Import a bundle. Replace {{API}} with the api the bundle is being imported into and upload the .zip file below.

```
If you wish to verify syntax as part of the upload. Add \&validate=true after {{API}}

 ```

`curl -v -u username:password -X POST http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations//apis?action=import\&name={{API}} -H "Content-Type: application/octet-stream" -T .zip`

Deploy the API in the environment you want to with a revision number one higher than the already existing revisions
    
`curl -v -u username:password -X POST http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/{{org}}/apis/{{API}}/revisions/<revisionnumber>/deployments?action=deploy\&env={{ENV}} -H "Content-Type: application/octet-stream"`

variable.description: Enter the unique API Name here

request.description:
Make sure all revisions of an API are removed before going ahead and undeploying an API

`curl -v -u username:password http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/<orgname>/apis/<api you want to delete> -X DELETE`

request.description:
add expand=true to the QS to get more info
  https://apidocs.apigee.com/management/apis/get/organizations/%7Borg_name%7D/apps-1

query.description: Optional. Set to true to expand the results. This query parameter does not work if you use the count or startKey query parameters.

Optional.

This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloud only.

Limits the list to the number you specify. The limit is 100. Use with the startKey parameter to provide more targeted filtering.

Optional.

This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloud only.

To filter the keys that are returned, enter the name of a company app that the list will start with. For example, if the an unfiltered list returns:

devapp1
devapp2
devapp3

Then, if your startKey is devapp2, the returned list will be:

devapp2
devapp3

request.description:
Lists all apps created by a developer in an organization, and optionally provides an expanded view of the apps. All time values in the response are UNIX times. You can specify either the developer's email address or Edge ID.
Apigee recommends that you use the developer's email address when calling this API. Developer IDs are generated internally by Apigee and are not guaranteed to stay the same over time. 
A maximum of 100 developers are returned per API call.
You can paginate the list of companies returned using the startKey and count query parameters.
 
Documentation ref: https://apidocs.apigee.com/management/apis/get/organizations/%7Borg_name%7D/developers/%7Bdeveloper_email_or_id%7D/apps
List out an app details

query.description:
Filters on various properties (e.g. filter=(request_verb%20in%20'POST','PUT'), and in sample value - the specific developer app name

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance#filteringresults
https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/analytics-reference#filters

Use the select query parameter to specify the metrics to retrieve, and an optional aggregation function, in the form.

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance#specifying-the-metrics-to-return

Use the timeRange query paramater to specify the time period (US format), in the form:
MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM~MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM
Do not use 24:00 as the time because it wraps around to 00:00. Use 23:59 instead.

request.description:
Average transactions per second (across all API calls, including errors) through the API in a given period of time.  
Use the analytics metrics API to gather detailed metrics.

request.description:
Total traffic over a given period (across all API calls, including errors) for all API Products.
Use the filter query param for refining search results to particular proxies, verbs or call types.

Documentation reference: https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance

Stats reference: https://apidocs.apigee.com/management/apis/get/organizations/%7Borg_name%7D/stats
https://apidocs.apigee.com/management/apis/post/organizations/%7Borg_name%7D/apiproducts

Returns the profile for a developer by email address or ID. All time values are UNIX time values. The profile includes the developer's email address, ID, name, and other information.
Note the following:
With Apigee Edge for Public Cloud, the response includes only the first **100** apps.
Apigee recommends that you use the developer's email address when calling this API. Developer IDs are generated internally by Apigee and are not guaranteed to stay the same over time.

query.description: Optional. Set to true to list developers exanded with details.

Optional.

Note: This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloude only.

Limits the list to the number you specify. Use with the startKey parameter to provide more targeted filtering. The limit is 1000.

Optional.

Note: This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloud only.

To filter the keys that are returned, enter the email of a developer that the list will start with. For example, if the an unfiltered list returns:

westley@example.com
fezzik@example.com
buttercup@example.com

and your startKey is fezzik@example.com, the returned list will be

fezzik@example.com
buttercup@example.com

request.description:
Lists all developers and their details (e.g. their apps) in an organization by email address. This call does not list any company developers who are a part of the designated organization.

With Apigee Edge for Public Cloud:
A maximum of **1000** developers are returned per API call.
You can paginate the list of companies returned using the startKey and count query parameters

  Update {{org}} and {{ENV}} variables as necessary to create a new environment

Updates a specific environment in an organization.Descriptionn could be updated using the same.

`curl -u user:passwd "http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/{{org}}/environments/{{ENV}}" `

Deletes a specific environment in an organization.

`curl "http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/{ORG}/environments/{ENV}" -X DELETE -u user:passwd `

item.name: Stats

query.description: Filters on the specific API proxy used in the product. Enter the name of the API here in this format (apiproxy%20eq%20'API_NAME')
Use the select query parameter to specify the metrics to retrieve, and an optional aggregation function, in the form.

Use the timeRange query paramater to specify the time period (US format), in the form:
MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM~MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM
Do not use 24:00 as the time because it wraps around to 00:00. Use 23:59 instead.

item.description: Get statistics/metrics on your API Proxies, such as TPS, error counts and message counts

request.description:
Adds a user to the org specified.

See body for values that are required

https://apidocs.apigee.com/management/apis/post/users

variable.description: Enter in your user email here to add as Org Admin

request.description:
Replace <org-name> with Organization name and <user-email> with users email

  If A different Role needs to be created the available options are

  -  orgadmin
    -  opsadmin
    -  user
    -  businessuser
    
  All have default permissions and full access to all entitires (APIs,API Products,Apps, Developers and Reports)

  More complex roles and permissions can be configured using the RBAC API
